name: You have responded
body:
Case number: ((reference number))

Dear ((first name)) ((last name))

You have responded to your ((partner))‘s ((isDivorce??divorce application))((isDissolution??application to end your civil partnership)). It will be sent to your ((partner)) after being checked by court staff. You do not have to do anything.

The next step is for your ((partner)) to apply for a ‘conditional order’. This is a document that says that the court does not see any reason why you cannot ((isDivorce??get divorced))((isDissolution??end your civil partnership)).

Your ((partner)) can apply for a conditional order on ((apply for CO date)). This is because they have to wait 20 weeks from when the ((isDivorce??divorce application))((isDissolution??application to end your civil partnership)) was issued. You will both receive a reminder.

You can track the progress of ((isDivorce??your divorce))((isDissolution??ending your civil partnership)) anytime: ((signin url))

Your feedback helps improve this service for others: https://smartsurvey.co.uk/s/SurveyExit/?service=Divorce&party=resp&def=n

Divorce and Dissolution
HM Courts & Tribunals Service
divorcecase@justice.gov.uk
0300 303 0642 (Monday to Friday, 8am to 6pm)
